intro: Gymnanthes concolor, commonly known as the yellow star fruit, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible when fully mature. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, and it thrives in warm, humid climates. The fruit is often cultivated for its unique flavor and ornamental value.
